intro: Chilocarpus alyxifolius, commonly known as the Alyxifolius holly, is a species of flowering plant in the family Ericaceae. It is characterized by its evergreen leaves, which are typically leathery and have a distinctive shape. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Its fruits are small, capsule-like structures that release seeds when mature. This species is native to specific regions in South America and thrives in moist, acidic soils.
